How to Run MOF2HTML on Unix

Last Updated 09/26/03

mof2html is a command that generates HTML files for the CIM classes defined in a MOF file. WARNING: The MOF file should include any Qualifier defintions that its class definitions require. See Simple.mof

  • Before running mof2html.sh, you must first install Xalan-Java v2.3.1 XSLT processor. Download xalan-j_2_3_1-bin.zip and extract into /usr/xalan-j_2_3_1. NOTE: If you install into another directory or have a different version installed, you must edit the XALAN_HOME variable in mof2html.sh
  • Go to the directory containing the WBEM Services executables.
    • If you built the WBEM Services executables in /files/open, go to directory /files/open/dist/wbemservices/bin.
    • If you downloaded or copied the WBEM Services executables into /wbemservices, go to directory /wbemservices/bin
  • Run sh mof2html.sh. You will see the following: 
     wbem% cd /files/open/dist/wbemservices/bin
 wbem% sh mof2html.sh
Usage: sh mof2html.sh mof_file
 wbem% sh mof2html.sh /files/open/dist/wbemservices/doc/Simple.mof
*********************************************************
Creating XML files from /files/open/dist/wbemservices/doc/Simple.mof in /files/open/dist/wbemservices/bin/xml
*********************************************************
/usr/java/bin/java -classpath .:/files/open/dist/wbemservices/bin/mofcomp.jar:/files/open/dist/wbemservices/cimom/lib/cimom.jar:/files/open/dist/wbemservices/lib/wbem.jar:/files/open/dist/wbemservices/cimom/lib/cimrepository.jar org.wbemservices.wbem.compiler.mofc.CIM_Mofc -v -x -b -o /files/open/dist/wbemservices/bin/xml /file/open/dist/wbemservices/doc/Simple.mof
Adding qualifier type Abstract
Adding qualifier type Aggregate
Adding qualifier type Aggregation
        :
        :
Adding qualifier type Weak
Adding qualifier type Write
Adding class Simple_Class
Compilation succeeded.
*********************************************************
Creating HTML files from XML files in /files/open/dist/wbemservices/bin/xml
*********************************************************
/usr/java/bin/java -classpath .:/usr/xalan-j_2_3_1/bin/xalan.jar:/usr/xalan-j_2_3_1/bin/xml-apis.jar:/usr/xalan-j_2_3_1/bin/xercesImpl.jar -Xmx128m org.apache.xalan.xslt.Process -in /files/open/dist/wbemservices/bin/xml/mof.xml -xsl /files/open/dist/wbemservices/bin/index.xsl -out /files/open/dist/wbemservices/bin/xml/mof.html

/usr/java/bin/java -classpath .:/usr/xalan-j_2_3_1/bin/xalan.jar:/usr/xalan-j_2_3_1/bin/xml-apis.jar:/usr/xalan-j_2_3_1/bin/xercesImpl.jar -Xmx128m org.apache.xalan.xslt.Process -in /files/open/dist/wbemservices/bin/xml/bigmof.xml -xsl /files/open/dist/wbemservices/bin/multimof.xsl -out /files/open/dist/wbemservices/bin/xml/mof.html

*********************************************************
In a browser, open /files/open/dist/wbemservices/bin/xml/index.html
*********************************************************
 wbem%
  • The generated .html files will be found in a subdirectory xml; e.g. /files/open/dist/wbemservices/bin/xml or /wbemservices/bin/xml. In a browser, open index.html
